page.title: 09FARMING,ELMLEY CASTLE AREA
page.content: Farmland dominates this area.The main crop is wheat followed by barley and grass.Chapel farm,Netherton grow perennial rye grass for seed production.About one sixth of the area is used for commercial sheep grazing ;one of the oldest flocks of pedigree Suffolk sheep for ram production.There is intensive pig,turkey and chicken production at Bricklehampton.Sugar beet,oil seed rape,winter and spring tick beans for livestock feed are also grown.Market gardeners and allotment holders grow peas,broad beans,runner beans,sprouts,spring onions and strawberries.The Forestry Commission maintain an area on the hill.There are no longer orchards.Former farm cottages are let or privately owned.
